record.creator: Logier, Johann Bernhard

record.subtitle: being a Selection of Favorite Irish Airs. arranged for the Piano Forte and Dedicated to the Irish Harp Societies, by J.B. Logier.

record.creator: Ross, John
record.title: The Pretty Green Banks of Cavan
record.subtitle: an Irish Air, arranged with Variations, and a Characteristic prelude, for the Piano Forte, by Mr. Ross, Organist of Aberdeen. Op. 45. Ross’s Airs, No. 6.

record.creator: Field, John
record.title: The Dance in Speed the Plough
record.subtitle: arranged as a Rondo for the Piano Forte by John Field

record.creator: Ross, John
record.title: Erin Go Bragh
record.subtitle: Ireland forever, a Favourite Irish Air with Variations for the Piano Forte composed by John Ross, Organist of St. Pauls, Aberdeen.

record.creator: Butler, Thomas Hamley (Hamly)
record.title: A new Slow Movement
record.subtitle: and a Favorite Irish Air, arranged as a Rondo for the Piano Forte by T.H. Butler. No. 17.

record.creator: Bourke, John
record.title: Cummilum
record.subtitle: An Irish Air, Composed by the Late W. Jackson Esq with Variations for the Piano Forte by J. Bourke.

record.creator: Panormo, Ferdinand Charles
record.title: National Variations
record.subtitle: to the Popular Air of The Minstrel Boy, from the Celebrated Irish Melodies Composed and Dedicated to Miss O’Connell, by Ferd. C. Panormo.

record.creator: Lynch, John P.
record.title: Kathleen O'More
record.subtitle: an Irish Ballad, with Variations for the Piano Forte, Composed and Arranged by J.P. Lynch. Lynch’s Variations No. 6.

record.creator: Ries, Ferdinand
record.title: Fantasia
record.subtitle: for the Piano Forte, or Harp in which is introduced two much admired Irish Airs, ‘Caílín beog cruite na mbo’, Rose Tree in full bearing. Composed & most respectfully dedicated (by Permission) to Her Grace the Duchess of Leinster, by Ferd. Ries.

record.creator: Southwell, Frederick William
record.title: A Duet
record.subtitle: for two Performers on One Piano Forte in which are Introduced Two Favorite Irish Melodies Arranged & Dedicated to Miss Maria Monck by F.W. Southwell.

record.creator: Panormo, Francis
record.title: Bryan Borue
record.subtitle: an Irish Air, the words altered from an Ancient Ballad and the Arrangements by Francis Panormo, adapted either for Singing or Playing

record.title: Grand Overture
record.subtitle: in which is Introduced the National Airs of God save the King & Patrick’s Day, Harmonized, and Performed by the Author at his Concert with unbounded applause. Composed and Dedicated to Miss Shaw (of Bushy Park, Co. Dublin) by Ferd. C. Panormo.

record.creator: Panormo, Ferdinand Charles
record.title: Farewell but whenever you welcome the hour
record.subtitle: an Irish Air from the celebrated Melodies With Variations for the Piano Forte, Composed and Dedicated to Miss Franks, by Ferdinand C. Panormo.

record.creator: Moscheles, Ignaz
record.title: The recollections of Ireland
record.subtitle: a Grand Fantasia, in which are introduced the favourite Airs, “The Groves of Blarney,” “Garry Owen,” and St. Patrick’s Day, for the Piano Forte, with Orchestral Accompaniments, Composed by I. Moscheles. Op. 69.

record.creator: Moran, Peter K.
record.title: The Kinnegad Slashers
record.subtitle: a Favorite Air Arranged as a Rondo for the Piano Forte by P.K. Moran.

record.creator: Wallace, William Vincent
record.title: The Irish Melodies
record.subtitle: “Kate Kearney,” and Tow Row Row, transcribed for the Piano Forte, by W. Vincent Wallace.

record.title: Two favorite Irish Melodies
record.subtitle: known as Go where Glory waits thee and Love’s Young Dream, arranged for the Piano Forte, and Dedicated to Miss Sarah Day, by William Vincent Wallace.

record.creator: Wallace, William Vincent
record.title: Two Favorite Irish Melodies
record.subtitle: known as The Harp that once through Tara’s Halls, and Fly not yet, arranged for the Piano Forte, and dedicated to Mrs. Bridgman Wade, of Jersey, by William Vincent Wallace.

record.creator: Despard, Charlotte Maria
record.title: Gramachree Molly
record.subtitle: a favorite Irish Air with variations for the Piano Forte or Harp. Composed & respectfully dedicated by Permission. To his Most Excellent Majesty, King George the Fourth by Miss Charlotte Maria Despard.

record.creator: Despard, Charlotte Maria
record.title: "My lodging is on the cold ground"
record.subtitle: a favorite Irish Air, with Variations for the Piano Forte or Harp, composed & respectfully dedicated by Permission. To his Most Excellent Majesty King George the Fourth, by Miss Charlotte Maria Despard.

record.creator: Bennett, Alicia
record.title: A Celebrated Irish Melody
record.subtitle: arranged as a Slow Movement, for the Piano Forte. Dedicated to Mrs Barlow (of Bath) by Alicia Bennett.

record.creator: Latour, Francis Tatton

record.title: An Tincer
record.subtitle: a favourite Irish air arranged with an Introduction and Variations, for the Piano Forte. Composed & Respectfully Dedicated to Mrs Col. Grogan by J.P. Lynch. No. 14.

record.creator: Logier, Johann Bernhard
record.title: Lays of Erin
record.subtitle: Selected and Arranged as Rondos, for the Piano Forte by the most Eminent Composers. No. 1

record.subtitle: with Variations and an Introduction for the Piano Forte. Composed for and Dedicated to Miss A. Egan by G. Kiallmark.

record.title: A Collection of Favorite Irish Airs

record.subtitle: for the Piano Forte, on the favorite Irish Airs, Coulin, Garry Owen, and St Patrick’s Day, Inscribed to Mrs Moscheles, by Pio Cianchettini, Op. 22 No. 2.

record.title: Fantasia
record.subtitle: composed and dedicated to Mrs. Willis by Pio Cianchettini.

record.creator: Blewitt, Jonathan

By the celebrated Irish Bard Carolan. Composed and Humbly Inscribed to the Kings Most Excellent Majesty, George the Fourth. By J. Blewitt.

record.subtitle: a Celebrated National Air, Composed & Arranged as a Rondo for the Piano Forte by J. Blewitt.

record.title: Go to the Devil and shake yourself
